result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel C Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Provide DNA sample.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.

timeConds.notes: Complete community service hours can be done at the Portage County Parks.

Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.   Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.   May serve Jail sentence on electronic monitor at 30 days in jail and balance to be served on electronic monitor. Sentence to commence w/in 60 days, must report to jail today to get a start date.  Jail can be transfered to any other county.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel C Castro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Daniel C Castro in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. (recommends probation w/conditions)
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2, 3, & 4 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Reddin concurs with joint agreement request for expungement, but may not be applicable.  

BY THE COURT:****PROBATION****
Count 1: (Felony) Posses w/Intent THC 2nd 961.41(1m)(h)2:
  I/S  Sentence:  6 mo jail sentence - stayed      24 mo  Probation  (can be transfered to any other county)
Conditions:
Pay costs + DNA surcharge =  $518.00
Provide DNA sample.
60 days jail w/ Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.   Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.   May serve Jail sentence on electronic monitor at 30 days in jail and balance to be served on electronic monitor. Sentence to commence w/in 60 days, must report to jail today to get a start date.  Jail can be transfered to any other county.
50 hrs Community Service with parks dept.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
No credit.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 


BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Daniel C Castro in court with attorney William J Reddin. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

3:29 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
